author: Lupin

review: Why did I waste my money on this?Ok, first off the bad:There is no "actual" youtube app. The one you see there is just a website disguised as an app. As such, logging in, registering it as a player, etc. are a pain.Netflix: simply wont work, has never worked. I reset my device to factory, reinstalled netflix. It will always start to stream, play maybe a second, then tell me it cant play this right now. Doesnt matter what I play. I have great internet, hardwired. This shouldnt be an issue.Loading anything else on it that you may want is a pain. gotta root (if you're lucky enough to be able to), and sideload APKs. None of these will show up on the homescreen or anywhere but in the system settings, so that sucks.the voice search button looked useful until I realised it ONLY works for amazon services. It doesnt even work for approved amazon firetv apps like netflix or vimeo or that terrible excuse for a youtube app.I am hoping and praying that some developers port a standard AndroidTV rom to this device, because currently Amazon's hatred for Google, despite them using tons of google to make their systems, is very evident and it ruins the device.

review: I am torn on this. I kinda like it. I tried getting plex to work on it and it was weak at best. I got this to have a media machine in the bedroom without having to put a computer in there. I thought it would be nice to have a replacement for XBMC. Plex just can not compete. With that being said I am in the process of installing the XBMC app on there and configuring it.I did notice it does have problems with constantly have to re queue large files. Not cool to be watching a movie and have it pause to re queue the movie. LOL.
